typeDescriptions.typeString: struct CampaignRewards.RewardRecipient storage ref[] storage ref
struct CampaignRewards.RewardRecipient storage ref[] storage ref
struct CampaignRewards.RewardRecipient storage ref[] storage ref

params._campaignId: ID of campaign reward contract belongs to

assignReward(uint256,uint256,address).details: Assigns a reward to a user after payment from parent contract Campaign

params._amount: Amount being paid by the user
params._rewardId: ID of the reward being assigned
params._user: Address of user reward is being assigned to

campaignSentReward(uint256,bool).details: Called by the campaign owner to indicate they delivered the reward to the rewardRecipient

params._rewardRecipientId: ID to struct containing reward and user to be rewarded
params._status: Indicates if the delivery was successful or not

params._active: Indicates if contributors can attain the reward
params._deliveryDate: Time in which reward will be deliverd to contriutors

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params._active: Indicates if contributors can attain the reward
params._deliveryDate: Time in which reward will be deliverd to contriutors

renounceRewards(address).details: Renounces rewards owned by the specified user

params._user: Address of user who rewards are being renounced

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

transferRewards(address,address).details: Transfers rewards from the old owner to a new owner

params._newAddress: Address of new owner rewards are being transferred to
params._oldAddress: Address of previous owner of rewards

userReceivedCampaignReward(uint256).details: Called by a user eligible for rewards to indicate they received their reward

params._rewardRecipientId: ID to struct containing reward and user to be rewarded
